description: Proposed single and two storey rear and side extension with replacement and new front dormer windows, new loft level accommodation and rear dormer window, alteration of front hipped roof to gable end and new entrance canopy, addition of hipped roof to existing two storey flat roof.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be commenced not later than three years from the date of this permission.
To comply with the requirements of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004).
All new external finishes shall be carried out in materials to match those of the existing building(s) to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area.
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).
For the avoidance of doubt and to ensure that the development is carried out as approved.

The windows inserted on the ensuites of the flank wall of the side extension to the south-eastern elevation shall be obscure-glazed, and non-opening unless the parts of the window which can be opened are more than 1.7m above the floor of the room in which the window is installed.
Reason - In the interest of privacy and to protect the amenity of the future occupants

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, no window or other opening (other than those shown on the submitted and approved plan,) shall be formed in the flank wall(s) of the building(s) hereby permitted, unless specific permission under the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 has first been sought and obtained in writing from the Local Planning Authority.
In order to ensure a satisfactory development that will not result in any loss of privacy or damage to the environment of neighbouring properties which exist or may be proposed in the future.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, improvements required to make the proposal acceptable were negotiated with the agent via email. The revisions involved reducing the bulk of the rear dormer. The amendments were subsequently submitted on 19/12/2023.

The proposal is liable for the Mayor of London Community Infrastructure Levy (CIL). The Mayoral CIL levy rate for Havering is £25 and is chargeable for each additional square metre of residential gross internal.  Based upon the information supplied with the application, £4,150 would be payable due to the area of the proposed extensions with 166sqm of GIA, however this may be adjusted subject to indexation.

The proposal is also liable for Havering Council's CIL. Havering's CIL charging rate for residential is £125.76 (Zone A)  for each additional square metre of GIA. Based upon the information supplied with the application, £20,876  would be payable, subject to indexation.

These charges are levied under s.206 of the Planning Act 2008.  CIL is payable within 60 days of commencement of development.
